summary: The 'Standardizing Accreditation information for Veteran Ease Act' (SAVE Act) amends Title 38 of the United States Code, focusing on improvements related to the recognition of individuals and organizations assisting veterans with benefits claims. It mandates an annual report to Congress detailing training, information gathering, verification methods, and database accuracy regarding recognized agents, attorneys, and representatives. It also requires the creation of a certification mark for recognized individuals and establishes a civil penalty for misuse. Finally, it mandates regular updates to the VA Accreditation Search Database, including contact information verification.
